@dalcde Yeah, because drawing a "precise" shape implies a shape of the domain/codomain. Making them blobs makes it more general.
If you learn Complex Analysis, you'll find that domains and codomains can have a shape to them. Actually, this is important for many of the theorems in Complex Analysis, and so a general "blob" shape is usually made to show that this works with any shaped set.
Notice that a function is bijective exactly when it is both surjective and injective.
